oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Scrap metal drive during WWII
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Black and white photograph of trucks and one mule-drawn wagon. The trucks and wagon are gathered on a street in anticipation of a scrap metal drive for World War II.

During World War II, scrap metal drives were a popular way for people to contribute to the war effort. By recycling unused or unwanted metal, the government could build ships, airplanes, and other equipment used in the war effort.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Looking Back at Tennessee Photograph Collection, 1890-1981
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Streets; Mules; Automobiles; Trucks; Carts & wagons; Scrap drives
